text:
(1) Barrett Park (Richmond): A cottage and part of the barn on the former estate of Clarence T. Barrett prior to the conversion of the property into a public park.

March 18, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The well on the Barrett estate, now (1938) Barrett Park.

March 18, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Richmond: Barrett Park - [Clarence T. Barrett estate.]

title: Richmond: Barrett Park - [Clarence T. Barrett estate.]

text:
(1) Barrett Park (Richmond): A view of the Clarence T. Barrett House within the park which was demolished several weeks later. The park occupies the site of the former Barrett estate.

P. L. Sperr.

March 18, 1934.

(2) A rear view of the house.

P. L. Sperr.

March 18, 1934.

(3) An exclusive view of the porch of the house.

March 18, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Richmond: Barrett Park - [Clarence T. Barrett estate.]

title: Richmond: Barrett Park - [Clarence T. Barrett estate.]

text:
(1)

Barrett Park (Richmond): Looking out (eastward) from the park at its Broadway entrance. It was formerly the drive-way to the Clarence T. Barrett House. On the right appears Colonial Court.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

Workmen are seen razing the old Clarence T. Barrett House, as viewed across Broadway from Colonial Court. The park is on the west side of Broadway.

P. L. Sperr
